name: extemporization
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a performance that an actor, musician, etc. has not prepared or planned, or the act of performing in this way: The familiar pieces are all at the beginning of the programme, followed by extemporisations. Audiences still prefer to listen to well-known works of art, not to a performer's extemporization.
More examplesFewer examplesThe boundary between composition and extemporization is sometimes unclear in her work.The group are famous for their love of extemporization.He performed a series of keyboard extemporisations.The song takes up less than half of the performance, with the rest taken up by extemporization.This approach to music education favoured technical drills over extemporisation.
